title: Function Concepts-Tabular and Analytical: Rational, Part C

content.question: Part C (i) Use the table of values of <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> to determine if <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is best modeled by a linear, quadratic, exponential, or logarithmic function. (ii) Give a reason for your answer based on the relationship between the change in the output values of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> and the change in the input values of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math>.

frqParts.text: Part C (i) Use the table of values of <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> to determine if <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is best modeled by a linear, quadratic, exponential, or logarithmic function. topic.text: 2.5: Exponential Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
